title: What champions are good without comping into them?
body:
So far, I'd think the following would be good without a comp
{{champion:53}} {{champion:555}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:203}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:157}} 

With items alone or not, these champs are generally high value alone.
You guys think anyone else deserves the mantle?

replies.body: Also ye Kennen is a very good anti-assassin with just PD and stick him as their primary target. He will wipe the entire enemy assassin comp 1v9.
Hard agree on Sej. She is a monster with glacial, but honestly just her ult is worth running her.
Pyke, sej, cho, gnar, kennen, yasuo can generally fit into any comp

My list would be something like this, but it depends on what point in the game you are talking too. {{champion:117}} Lulu is quite good early/mid, but is pretty bad late game by herself.


{{champion:53}} Blitzcrank (for cheese against idiots... aka people not watching)
{{champion:119}} Draven (just needs a front line and a couple items)
{{champion:31}} Cho'Gath (giant ball of stats with a very good CC ability)
{{champion:63}} Brand (damage damage)
{{champion:84}} Akali (if you have the open slot, she can easily pull her weight)
{{champion:157}} Yasuo (duh... hasagi!)
{{champion:555}} Pyke (kinda overtuned... not as bad as before, but still kinda bonkers)


To some extent, a lot of mythic/legendary units can just be thrown in as a replacement to something you have just because they are bigger and stronger than what you have, and pull a decent amount of weight for it.

shen and blitzcrank i'm not sold on..Veigar as well, as much as i enjoy the guy on my team without having that sorcerer comp or yordles i don't see why you would ever take him on his on 

Asol, Draven, Brand, Pyke and Lulu imo are the only ones that can be splashed into almost anything and can win so long as you can toss some items on them

Shen as a stand alone unit benefits from a higher attack damage with an AoE protection as an ability, that makes him pretty valuable granted not as valuable as some of the others but by himself without any support is still considerably decent.

Blitzcrank is harder to employ, but having the ability to break a formation as soon as the fight starts is a large benefit in its own way. While he isn't solo carry material, he offers powerful utility as soon as the round starts.

Veigar's power isn't in how much damage he outputs but rather in his execution passive on his ability and being a sorcerer, his mana gain and spam potential. He does require some resources, but he alone can carry through simply being a higher star level

i didnt really need you to tell me what they do, i already know that and that's why i said i disagreed. 

those 3 i pointed out are too weak on their own despite having limited splashability; i mean if u happen to get a veigar or shen to lv 3 wit items then good for you but on their own when you talk consistency it's not worth it. 

I'd pick a Gnar over Shen tbh, or Gnar over Blitz, if you are talking about just straight up on their own.
